replies.body:
I do believe if you report that person and enough people report that person especially for the same thing that they will get some form of punishment from Riot. It's not that these players are necessarily being dealt with but there is such a high influx of negative attitude players because this game can cause some high frustration.

I don't want to sound like a lollipop but honestly I've changed my attitude when I enter my games and I hardly get mad and I just stay positive. This has made my entire team 70-80% of the time stay positive too when they know they're not going to be abused for their bad mistakes as well. Although it's not a perfect world and no matter what you do people are going to be abusive or negative. 

Also aside from reporting them if you do get extremely toxic players in your game and they actually dish out some threats or some terrible terrible stuff I'd recommend taking a few screenshots and contacting Riot directly. 

Thanks!

Hey layowin and DarkDraagoon,

I'm really sorry you guys have gone through leavers in games. But naming and shaming is against the rules of the boards so I have deleted the name. I am more than happy to discuss the current punishment systems we have in place for Leavers.

You can find full info about every system here- http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/L65wrRYe-player-behaviour-faq-updated-for-instant-feedback

But the one that specifically relates to Leavers is called Leaver buster. How this punishment system works is if a player leaves a high number of games they will be put in low priority queue. What this means is if a player is on low priority queue from leaving they must wait 5-20 minutes before they can queue for a game.

For example a common punishment for leavers is 5 games with 20 minute wait time. This means for the next 5 games that leaver will have to wait 20 minutes before they are allowed in queue.

You can read more about leaver buster here - https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ

Hey man,

So you seem to bring up 2 points in your post.

1) Why don't we give players uncooperative/bm banners?

We don't do this because we believe in player reform, a lot of our punishments gives players the opportunity to reform and change their ways. If players don't reform after a few punishments then we ban them.

Now the reason we don't give players banners to let everyone else know they've wronged in the past is, can you imagine going into a game and seeing oh a person on my team has AFKed, or a person on my team has bad manners. It would instantly set a bad tone for the game, even if no one has said anything.

2) Leaver buster just gives more time to do other things.
Thats the point, we force players to stop playing League of Legends as punishment. This has been shown to be more effective than bans and let me expand a little on why.

e.g. 5 game 20 minute low priority queue or 3 day ban.

What the low priority queue does is it forces you to  wait through the ban (you have to be logged in and in queue for 5*20 minutes).

However if a player is banned for 3 days they can easily just log onto another account and instantly play LoL again and just wait out the ban on another account.

The low priority queue really forces the punished player to feel the punishment in comparison to a ban.
